text: Wilby is an unincorporated community in northern Butler County, in the U.S. state of Missouri. The community is on Missouri Route O approximately seven miles north of Poplar Bluff. It sits on the east margin of the Black River floodplainMissouri Atlas & Gazetteer, DeLorme, First edition, 1998, p. 67 at an elevation of 361 feet. The community of Hilliard lies three miles to the south-southeast along the Black River.Poplar Bluff, MO, 7.5 Minute Topographic Quadrangle, USGS, 1966 (1979 rev.) The Missouri Pacific Railway passes the west side of the community along the Black River floodplain. The community lies within the Mark Twain National Forest. The community most likely was named after Wilby, a railroad employee. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Butler County, Missouri Category:Unincorporated communities in Missouri
title: Wilby, Missouri
